reviews.review_msg: This was one of the most enlightening classes that I have had the pleasure to attend over my entire student career at SFU. Professor Fawcett is very passionate about what she teaches and has a great sense of humor. She makes her class fun and gives her students opportunities to explore and get hands on experience. I learned so much - great class!
Don't buy the textbook--it was a waste of money.  Not very clear about her marking or what she expected for the assignments.

She is very friendly and soft-spoken.  Expect a lot of group assignments(bulk of your mark) and a bunch of small assignments.  She marks rather hard and it was so unclear why she graded some people a certain way and others differently... also does not like  people questioning their grades.  DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK...WAS NOT NECESSARY FOR ANYTHING
Elina was so lovely to have! I think she really cared about the well-being of students and wanted everyone to succeed. It was great to have her as a prof.

Nice professor, however does not give much feedback and marks hard than expected. No one got a perfect mark on our paper, yet she stated that she enjoyed them. Textbook was not very useful, except for weekly questions that don't even require you to read the book to get the answer to them, mostly opinion-based. Final exam was clear.
very nice prof, minimal workload & easy gpa booster

A very knowledgeable prof., but has some diff. imparting info. due to frequent though interesting tangents in her discussions.  I would have found the course more accesible with overheads, powerpoint, or handouts... for clarity and direction of discussion
This class has the potential to be a lot more interesting. Ok with 1-1 help
Class is very boring. nothing much to say.
